name: Eject Button
effect: Quickly moves your Pokémon in the designated direction.

name: Full Heal
effect: Removes all status conditions from your Pokémon and makes it immune to hindrances for a short time.

name: Potion
effect: Restores some of your Pokémon’s HP.

name: X-Attack
effect: Raises your Pokémon’s Attack and Sp. Atk for a short time.

name: X-Speed
effect: For a short time, increases your Pokémon's movement speed and prevents their movement speed from being reduced.

name: Goal-Getter
effect: Doubles goal scoring speed for a short time.

name: Fluffy Tail
effect: Leaves a wild Pokémon unable to attack for a short time and also increases damage dealt to those Pokémon.

name: Slow Smoke
effect: Creates a cloud of smoke that greatly decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon for a short time.

name: Rocky Helmet
effect: When the Pokémon receives a certain amount of damage, damage is dealt to nearby opposing Pokémon based on its HP.

name: Assault Vest
effect: When the Pokémon is not in combat, they are granted a shield that nullifies Sp. Atk damage.

name: Exp. Share
effect: While the Pokémon has the fewest Exp. Points on its team, it gains Ex. Points per second. However, it will no longer receive shared Exp. Points when its teammates defeat wild Pokémon

name: Sp. Atk Specs
effect: When the Pokémon scores a goal, its Sp. Atk increases.

name: Attack Weight
effect: When the Pokémon scores a goal, its Attack increases.

name: Aeos Cookie
effect: When the Pokémon scores a goal, its max HP increases.

name: Score Shield
effect: While the Pokémon is attempting to score a goal, it is granted a shield based off its max HP and its goals cannot be interrupted while it is shielded.

name: Buddy Barrier
effect: When the Pokémon uses its Unite Move, that Pokémon and the nearby ally Pokémon with the lowest HP are each granted a shield based off their max HP.

name: Float Stone
effect: Increases movement speed when the Pokémon is not in combat.

name: Focus Band
effect: When the Pokémon drops to low HP, then each second for three seconds, it recovers some of the HP it had lost.

name: Shell Bell
effect: When the Pokémon hits with a move, it recovers HP. The higher the Pokémon's Sp. Atk, the more HP it recovers.

name: Muscle Band
effect: When basic attacks hit, the damage is increased by a percentage of the opponent's Pokémon remaining HP.

name: Leftovers
effect: When the Pokémon is not in combat, it recovers some of its max HP every second.

name: Energy Amplifier
effect: After the Pokémon uses its Unite Move, the damage the Pokémon deals is increased for a short time.

name: Wise Glasses
effect: Increases Sp. Atk.

name: Scope Lens
effect: Increases the damage of basic attack critical hits. The higher the Pokémon's Attack, the more the damage increases.
